perturbation.original_text: The amount of power generated shall be calculated based on the indicator of electricity meter in the power station. The settlement date is the first day of the next month. Deducting the dues of Party A, Party B should pay Party A the energy saving service fee of the last month before the 15t h of each month. Payment method: Wire or transfer.
perturbation.changed_text: The amount of power generated shall be calculated based on the indicator of electricity meter in the power station. The settlement date is the first day of the next month. Deducting the dues of Party A, Party B *may* pay Party A the energy saving service fee of the last month before the 15th of each month. Payment method: Party A will determine the payment method.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states a definitive payment date. The modified version introduces uncertainty by stating 'may' instead of 'should', suggesting that the payment is not guaranteed by the 15th. It is now up to Party A to decide the 'payment method' which could be different than 'wire or transfer', or the conditions where those payments methods would be authorized.
perturbation.location: Item Three, Cost and Operation Target, sections 3,4,5

perturbation.original_text: The term of the agreement is 20 years, during which if any main equipment of any Party stops operation due to technical problem or at the end of its life cycle, the agreement shall be automatically terminated. In case of that happens, the Party B will have the full rights to dispose the system of Party A.
perturbation.changed_text: The term of the agreement is 20 years, during which if any main equipment of any Party stops operation due to technical problem or at the end of its life cycle, the agreement *may* be terminated. In case of that happens, the Party B *may* have the full rights to dispose the system of Party A.
perturbation.explanation: The original text stated the contract would automatically be terminated if any main equipment stopped operation. The new text states that the contract *may* be terminated, creating an uncertainty. Before, Party B had the right to the system of Party A but the new text indicates Party B *may* have the rights, creating an uncertainty on the terms of this clause.
perturbation.location: Item Four Starting and End Date for Recycling Project and Term, section 2

perturbation.original_text: During the contact period, Party A has the ownership of the CDQ and CDQ waste heat power generation systems. After the termination of the contact, Party B has the disposition right to the project.
perturbation.changed_text: During the contact period, Party A has the ownership of the CDQ and CDQ waste heat power generation systems. After the termination of the contact, Party B has *shared* disposition right to the project.
perturbation.explanation: The original text stated after termination of the contract, party B has the *disposition right to the project*. The new text indicates Party B has a *shared* disposition right to the project, which creates an uncertainty because Party A also owned the CDQ during the contract period. Therefore, the change to *shared* disposition right is not very clear.
